New Records: Keon Ellis assisted on a 3-pointer by Keon Ellis before DeRozan tied it on a basket with a minute left
Key Match Events: Fox started the surge with a short floater
A goaltending call against the 76ers on Monk's driving layup gave the Kings the lead with 33.1 seconds to play
George lost the ball and fouled Monk, who hit two free throws to make it 111-107 with 7.1 seconds left
Pre-Game Insights: Joel Embiid (sprained left foot) and Kelly Oubre Jr. (sprained left hand) did not play for the Sixers, while Keegan Murray was sidelined for the Kings with left ankle soreness
Post-Match Reflections: Sacramento trailed by 14 in the first half but tied it 57-all at halftime
Philadelphia then led 107-98 with 3:15 remaining before the Kings took over
Miscellaneous Highlights: Maxey connected on his third 3-pointer with 6:52 left. He has made at least three shots from beyond the arc in 10 straight games, a franchise record
Sabonis pulled down nine of Sacramento's 14 offensive rebounds
Others: Sacramento (15-19) held the 76ers (13-18) scoreless for the final 3:30 and improved to 8-12 at home
